intro: Microstylis quadridentata, commonly known as the four-toothed microstylis, is a small herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive four-toothed appearance at the base, giving it its scientific name. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
